abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study of gun violence and fatalities in city of Wilmington, Del, has been welcomed by residents and has caught attention of researchers around country, particularly in light of fact that agency has been limited in its investigation of gun violence by congressional funding restrictions.
lead_paragraph: A report on shootings in Wilmington notes patterns in the lives of those involved, a fairly rare study by an agency limited from such research by congressional appropriation.

headline.main: When Gun Violence Felt Like a Disease, a City in Delaware Turned to the C.D.C.
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Studies Disease in a Delaware City: Gunfire

snippet: A report on shootings in Wilmington notes patterns in the lives of those involved, a fairly rare study by an agency limited from such research by congressional appropriation.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
